The data is there for its exploitation by machine learning technology, bid data, data mining and other artificial intelligence technologies that coupled with traditional statistical analysis enable to produce insights into the future. Nothing is more valuable than anticipation. Thus, data scientist are finding jobs in all disciplines.

Some problems may be simple and you will solve them drawing on knowledge you acquired through your course of study or using your accumulated experiences. Subject_Description_2: Engineering mechanics is both a foundation and a framework for most engineering disciplines. This course provides a basic knowledge of Newtonian mechanics, rigid-body mechanics, elasticity and structural analysis. In particular, the principles of statics and their applications in engineering, the methods of static analysis, and techniques of engineering computation are expounded. Students are expected not only to acquire a good grasp of the principles but also to develop the computational and analytical skills which are vital in obtaining correct engineering solutions. In practice, a wrong solution can lead to an engineering disaster. This course is designed to enable students to acquire fundamental knowledge in engineering. It forms an integral part of the analysis and design training provided in the Engineering programs. This course is offered in trimester 2 and 3 at both the Gold Coast and Nathan campuses.
Subject_Description_3: The course revises and extends basic integral and differential calculus of one variable and introduces differential equations. It provides a foundation in the mathematical sciences needed for later studies both in an engineering and science context. This course is for Engineering or ICT students ONLY. Incompatible: 1202SCG Calculus I
Subject_Description_4: This course deals with continuous-time signals and systems and is designed to build on the basic circuit analysis concepts covered in the course Electric Circuits. It provides a detailed study of continuous-time signals and systems in time domain as well as in transformed domain. Signal transforms (Fourier series, Fourier transform and Laplace transforms) are covered in detail. Further concepts such as signal sampling and aliasing are introduced. The theory is exemplified with processing of signals in MATLAB. Incompatible: 2006MEE Signals and Systems AND 2075ENG Signals and Systems
Subject_Description_5: Soil Mechanics is an important part of geotechnical engineering that deals with the engineering properties of various soils. This course provides students with valuable opportunities to develop their understanding of the fundamentals of soil behavior, and skills that will allow them to apply their knowledge to solve real-life problems. Students will also have the opportunity to become familiar with various testing procedures and learn how to perform laboratory tests to determine the geotechnical properties of soil such as grain-size distribution, plasticity, compaction characteristics, and permeability. After completing this course, students will acquire sufficient knowledge and develop critical skills that will enable them to solve practical problems related to soil mechanics
Subject_Description_6: This course explores the common modulation techniques including amplitude and angle modulation for both analogue and digital information signals. Applications examined include radio, television and telecommunications. The course looks at both system level and circuit level. Many examples are examined for circuits for mixers, modulators, demodulators, oscillators, frequency synthesisers, RF amplifiers and radio and television receivers and transmitters. Design of amplification stages utilising classes A, B, C and D are examined. Methods and importance of shielding at high frequencies is also covered. A series of laboratories explore construction and measurement of communication circuits. Incompatible: 2304ENG Communication Systems and Circuits AND 3007MEE Communication Systems and Circuits
Subject_Description_7: This course provides the fundamental knowledge of fluid mechanics and hydraulics including fluid properties, fluid statics, conservation of mass, energy equation, flow in conduits, pumps and turbines, flow around objects, open channel flow and compressible flow.
Subject_Description_8: This course will combine an extension of the study of geomechanics to pavement engineering techniques with the principles of traffic flow theory and pavement engineering techniques so that students can apply them to practice. The course covers traffic flow models, headway models, traffic fundamental diagrams, intersection design and assessment, pavement engineering and design, pavement condition survey and pavement management. This course will be assessed by individual based assignment, mid trimester exam, and final exam.
Subject_Description_9: Engineering Programming is an introductory course to computer programming. It uses the C language to teach basic programming structure, flow and syntax. It also includes a module on the similar language used by the MATLAB package. Incompatible: 2312ENG C Programming and Computer Architecture. From 2017 this course will be offered in trimester 2 at both the Gold Coast and Nathan campuses.
Subject_Description_10: This course introduces students to engineering design practice utilising real world design exercises. The course gives students a solid grounding in current engineering practice and emphasises the importance of incorporating sustainable approaches and sound practices to their designs. This course may involve individual or team approaches, depending on the nature of the design task. Incompatible: 2106ENG Design for Civil Engineers
